Directives > ui-input-container

Input Container

Normal label with Light theme


<ui-input-container>
    <label>Last name</label>
    <input class="ui-input light" type="text" name="lastName" placeholder="Last name">
</ui-input-container>

Normal label with dark theme


<ui-input-container>
    <label class="dark">Last name</label>
    <input class="ui-input dark" type="text" name="lastName" placeholder="Last name">
</ui-input-container>

With Error with Light theme

  • input field is required
  • Minimun length is 4 char long
  • Maximum length is 10 char long
This is required!
That's too short!
 

<form name="userForm">
    <ui-input-container>
        <label>Last name</label>
        <input class="ui-input light"
               type="text"
               name="lastName"
               ng-model="uiInputContainerData.lastName"
               placeholder="Last name"
               required
               maxlength="10"
               minlength="4">
        <div ng-messages="userForm.lastName.$error" ng-if='userForm.lastName.$dirty'>
            <div ng-message="required">This is required!</div>
            <div ng-message="minlength">That's too short!</div>
        </div>
    </ui-input-container>
</form>

With Error with Dark theme

  • input field is required
  • field should be an email address
This is required!
This is not a valid email address!
 

<form name="emailForm">
    <ui-input-container style="width: 250px;">
        <label class="dark">Email address</label>
        <input class="ui-input dark"
               type="email"
               name="email"
               ng-model="uiInputContainerData.email"
               placeholder="email address"
               required>
        <div ng-messages="emailForm.email.$error" ng-if='emailForm.email.$dirty'>
            <div ng-message="required">This is required!</div>
            <div ng-message="email">This is not a valid email address!</div>
        </div>
    </ui-input-container>
</form>
